com.davidsoergel.trees

Class AbstractRootedPhylogeny<T extends Serializable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.davidsoergel.trees.AbstractRootedPhylogeny<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HierarchyNode<T,PhylogenyNode<T>>, LengthWeightHierarchyNode<T,PhylogenyNode<T>>, PhylogenyNode<T>, RootedPhylogeny<T>, TaxonMergingPhylogeny<T>, Serializable, Cloneable, Iterable<PhylogenyNode<T>>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BasicRootedPhylogeny

    public abstract class AbstractRootedPhylogeny<T extends Serializable>
extends Object
implements RootedPhylogeny<T>
    Abstract implementation of the RootedPhylogeny interface, providing all required functionality that is not implementation-specific.
    Version:
    $Id: AbstractRootedPhylogeny.java 354 2009-10-19 19:01:44Z soergel $
    Author:
    David Soergel
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  AbstractRootedPhylogeny.MutualExclusionResolutionMode
      When we request extraction of a tree with a bunch of nodes, and one of those nodes is an ancestor of the other, do we include only the leaf, only the ancestor, both, or throw an exception? BOTHNOBRANCHLENGTH is a compromise between ANCESTOR and BOTH; both nodes are provided, but all branch lengths below the ancestor are set to zero.

      • extractTreeWithLeafIDs

        @NotNull
public BasicRootedPhylogeny<T> extractTreeWithLeafIDs(Set<T> ids,
                                                     boolean ignoreAbsentNodes,
                                                     boolean includeInternalBranches)
                                                                    throws NoSuchNodeException
        Specified by:
        extractTreeWithLeafIDs in interface TaxonMergingPhylogeny<T extends Serializable>
        Throws:
        NoSuchNodeException

      • extractTreeWithLeafIDs

        @NotNull
public BasicRootedPhylogeny<T> extractTreeWithLeafIDs(Set<T> ids,
                                                     boolean ignoreAbsentNodes,
                                                     boolean includeInternalBranches,
                                                     AbstractRootedPhylogeny.MutualExclusionResolutionMode mode)
                                                                    throws NoSuchNodeException
        Extract a tree which contains exactly those leaves that are requested. I.e., prunes any branches not leading to those leaves. Aggregates chains of nodes with exactly one child each into a single branch of the appropriate length, if requested. Creates the extracted tree from newly instantiated nodes; does not reuse nodes from the base tree. Some of the requested leaves my turn out to be internal nodes; that's OK.
        Specified by:
        extractTreeWithLeafIDs in interface TaxonMergingPhylogeny<T extends Serializable>
        Parameters:
        ids - the Collection of leaves desired for the extracted tree
        ignoreAbsentNodes - silently ignore requests for leaves that are not present in the tree, simply returning the extracted tree with those leaves that are found. I.e., intersect the requested leaf id list with the available leaf ids before constructing the result tree.
        Returns:
        the extracted RootedPhylogeny
        Throws:
        NoSuchNodeException - when the given collection contains a node id that is not found in the tree and ignoreAbsentNodes is false

public List<BasicPhylogenyNode<T>> getAncestorPathAsBasic(T id)
                                                                        throws NoSuchNodeException
        Description copied from interface: TaxonMergingPhylogeny
        Returns a List of nodes leading from the root to the leaf identified by the given ID. Guarantees that the nodes are represented as BasicPhylogenyNodes, copying them if necessary, because we want them to be Serializable. As a result, the child lists may not be populated.
        Specified by:

      • extractSubtreeWithLeafPaths

        @NotNull
protected BasicPhylogenyNode<T> extractSubtreeWithLeafPaths(Set<List<? extends PhylogenyNode<T>>> theDisposableAncestorLists,
                                                        boolean includeInternalBranches,
                                                        AbstractRootedPhylogeny.MutualExclusionResolutionMode mode)
                                                                          throws NoSuchNodeException
        Builds a fresh tree containing all of the requested leaves, which are the last elements in the provided AncestorLists. Each AncestorList describes the path from the root to one of the leaves. The roots (the first element of each list) must be equal; a copy of that root provides the root of the newly built tree. If includeInternalBranches is set, then all elements of the AncestorLists will be included in the resulting tree even if there is no branching at that node.
        Parameters:
        theDisposableAncestorLists -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        TreeException
        NoSuchNodeException

      • setBasePhylogeny

        public void setBasePhylogeny(RootedPhylogeny<T> basePhylogeny)

      • extractIntersectionTree

        public BasicRootedPhylogeny<T> extractIntersectionTree(Collection<T> leafIdsA,
                                              Collection<T> leafIdsB,
                                              NodeNamer<T> namer)
                                                                     throws NoSuchNodeException,
                                                                            TreeException
        Builds a new phylogeny by finding all branches that ultimately lead to a least one leaf in each of two sets. The intersection tree contains branches terminating at internal nodes that are common between the two trees, even if there are no leaves in common below that node.

        The weights in the resulting tree are taken from this one. but may not be normalized.

        Specified by:
        extractIntersectionTree in interface RootedPhylogeny<T extends Serializable>
        Parameters:
        leafIdsA - a Collection of leaf IDs, all of which should be present in this tree
        leafIdsB - another Collection of leaf IDs, all of which should be present in this tree
        Returns:
        the RootedPhylogeny describing the portion of this tree that is in common between the trees specified by the two leaf sets
        Throws:
        TreeException - when anything goes wrong
        NoSuchNodeException

      • mixWith

        public BasicRootedPhylogeny<T> mixWith(RootedPhylogeny<T> otherTree,
                              double mixingProportion)
                                                     throws TreeException
        Builds a new phylogeny by mixing this tree with another one. This is useful when the trees represent communities, in which case the mixed tree represents a literal mixing of the communities. The two trees in question must have been extracted from the same underlying tree (e.g., the tree of life), to guarantee that their topologies are compatible (though of course the weights will differ). The mixing is done at the leaves; the resulting weights are then summed up the tree as usual.
        Specified by:
        mixWith in interface RootedPhylogeny<T extends Serializable>
        Parameters:
        otherTree - the RootedPhylogeny with which to mix this one
        mixingProportion - the double proportion of this tree to use in the mixture; the other tree will be used with (1-mixingProportion)
        Returns:
        the RootedPhylogeny the mixed phylogeny
        Throws:
        TreeException - when the requested proportion is not between 0 and 1, or if the two trees are not derived from the same base tree.

      • smoothWeightsFrom

        public void smoothWeightsFrom(RootedPhylogeny<T> otherTree,
                     double smoothingFactor)
                       throws TreeException
        Assign leaf weights to this tree based on the weights present in the provided tree, smoothed by adding pseudocounts. This is useful to avoid weights of zero, in cases where that would cause division errors and such. The pseudocount is added uniformly to every leaf of this tree, regardless of the tree topology, and whether or not the node has any weight in the other tree. If the other tree assigns weight to nodes that are not present in this tree, those weights are silently ignored. Finally the weights in this tree are normalized and summed up the tree as usual.
        Specified by:
        smoothWeightsFrom in interface RootedPhylogeny<T extends Serializable>
        Parameters:
        otherTree - the RootedPhylogeny from which to copy weights
        smoothingFactor - the double pseudocount to add to all leaf weights
        Throws:
        TreeException
